sources.data_found: NOTS cluster has 159 nodes; 2024 expansion provided 88 million CPU core hours and 750 thousand GPU hours annually. ARIES cluster is a donation from AMD with 12 million CPU hours and 1.5 million GPU hours annually. RAPID is a small GPU-only cluster with 80 Nvidia GPUs for interactive compute.
Aries Cluster - This resource was donated by AMD, and it contains 152 MI50 GPUs and 24 MI100 GPUs. It is an excellent resource for 'big' users (those that require at least 8 GPUs at a time).

student_data.notes: From DataUSA.io: In 2023, General Computer & Information Sciences (281 degrees) was the second most popular Masters Degree concentration at Rice. The undergraduate CS count is estimated based on typical 60% BA and 40% BS split mentioned in CS department documentation, with degrees awarded typically representing ~70% of total enrolled students (accounting for 4-year program duration). PhD count based on 16 doctoral degrees reported for 2021-2022 academic year by CollegeFactual. [WARNING: Original source was inaccessible, using fallback.]

other_high_vram_gpus.notes: RAPID (Rice Analysis Platform for Interactive Data) has 80 Nvidia GPUs. Specific models not disclosed in sources found.
ARIES cluster contains 152 MI50 GPUs (16GB HBM2 memory each, 13.3 TFLOPS FP32)
ARIES cluster contains 24 MI100 GPUs (32GB HBM2 memory each, 11.5 TFLOPS FP64)
2 NOTS nodes equipped with 4 Tesla K80 GPUs each = 8 total K80 GPUs

gpu_resources.notes: Rice operates three main GPU-enabled clusters: NOTS (general-purpose Intel cluster with GPU nodes), ARIES (AMD GPU cluster with 152 MI50 + 24 MI100), and RAPID (80 Nvidia GPUs). The specific NVIDIA models in RAPID and additional GPU nodes in NOTS expansion were not detailed in available sources. GPU hour allocations: NOTS expansion provides 750K GPU hours/year, ARIES provides 1.5M GPU hours/year.

analysis_notes: GPU data is limited - Rice documentation focuses on GPU hours available rather than specific hardware inventory. AMD GPU counts are concrete (ARIES cluster), but NVIDIA GPU models in RAPID cluster and newer NOTS nodes not specified. Student enrollment based on degrees awarded data from DataUSA.io, with undergraduate count estimated from typical program duration.
